alert.note: Alert for City of Bristol; Scott; Washington (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 12:48PM EST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Bristol, Scott and Washington. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1248 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bristol Tn, Bristol Va, Abingdon, Glade Spring, Damascus, Hilander Park, Lindell, Emory-Meadow View, Benhams and Konnarock. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
